poem:
### Missile Talk

Winged whispers of thundercloud
dawdle across the stratosphere,  
their whispers poorly chosen—  
a reckless conversation  
that flies too close  
to borders drawn  
on cold atlases.  
Skyward, they tug leashes  
of weather-worn dogs  
while men in steel cocoons  
play at petulance,  
in suits of leaden tongues.

Putin said on Sunday that Russia had successfully tested its “unique” nuclear-capable Burevestnik cruise missile, which the Kremlin described as part of efforts to “ensure the country’s national security”. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
